items.title: The latest kfp=1.0.0 on Pypi is outdated
items.body:
Hello all,
I found that the content of the package kfp==1.0.0 uploaded on [Pypi](https://pypi.org/project/kfp/1.0.0/#description) differs from the one available here on Github. It is outdated. 

### What steps did you take:
[A clear and concise description of what the bug is.]
```sh
# Download kfp from Pypi
curl -O https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/ea/41/130df5822c73e42815250683634828c69449225ae61fc14f5b13884c2898/kfp-1.0.0.tar.gz

# Download a file that was modified in the 1.0.0 release
curl -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/pipelines/master/sdk/python/kfp/dsl/_ops_group.py -o gh_ops_group.py

# Uncompress kfp
tar zxf kfp-1.0.0.tar.gz

# Diff the _ops_group.py downloaded from Github and the one downloaded from Pypi
diff gh_ops_group.py kfp-1.0.0/kfp/dsl/_ops_group.py
31c31
<   def __init__(self, group_type: str, name: str=None, parallelism: int=None):
---
>   def __init__(self, group_type: str, name: str=None):
33d32
< 
37d35
<       parallelism (int): parallelism for the sub-DAG:s
45d42
<     self.parallelism = parallelism
54c51
<     """Retrieves the opsgroup when the pipeline already contains it.
---
>     """retrieves the opsgroup when the pipeline already contains it.
56d52
<   
59,60c55
<       name (str): the name before conversion.
<     """
---
>       name (str): the name before conversion. """
110,122c105,111
<   Args:
<     exit_op: An operator invoked at exiting a group of ops.
< 
<   Raises:
<     ValueError: Raised if the exit_op is invalid.
< 
<   Example:
<     ::
< 
<       exit_op = ContainerOp(...)
<       with ExitHandler(exit_op):
<         op1 = ContainerOp(...)
<         op2 = ContainerOp(...)
---
>   Example usage:
>   ```python
>   exit_op = ContainerOp(...)
>   with ExitHandler(exit_op):
>     op1 = ContainerOp(...)
>     op2 = ContainerOp(...)
>   ```
125a115,121
>     """Create a new instance of ExitHandler.
>     Args:
>       exit_op: an operator invoked at exiting a group of ops.
> 
>     Raises:
>       ValueError is the exit_op is invalid.
>     """
142,151c138,143
<   Args:
<     condition (ConditionOperator): the condition.
<     name (str): name of the condition
< 
<   Example:
<     ::
< 
<       with Condition(param1=='pizza', '[param1 is pizza]'):
<         op1 = ContainerOp(...)
<         op2 = ContainerOp(...)
---
>   Example usage:
>   ```python
>   with Condition(param1=='pizza', '[param1 is pizza]'):
>     op1 = ContainerOp(...)
>     op2 = ContainerOp(...)
>   ```
154a147,151
>     """Create a new instance of Condition.
>     Args:
>       condition (ConditionOperator): the condition.
>       name (str): name of the condition
>     """
162,164d158
< 
<   Args:
<     name: Name of the graph.
176,181c170,176
<   Example:
<     In this case :code:`op1` would be executed twice, once with case :code:`args=['echo 1']` and once with case :code:`args=['echo 2']`::
< 
<       with dsl.ParallelFor([{'a': 1, 'b': 10}, {'a': 2, 'b': 20}]) as item:
<         op1 = ContainerOp(..., args=['echo {}'.format(item.a)])
<         op2 = ContainerOp(..., args=['echo {}'.format(item.b])
---
>   Example usage:
>   ```python
>   with dsl.ParallelFor([{'a': 1, 'b': 10}, {'a': 2, 'b': 20}]) as item:
>     op1 = ContainerOp(..., args=['echo {}'.format(item.a)])
>     op2 = ContainerOp(..., args=['echo {}'.format(item.b])
>   ```
>   and op1 would be executed twice, once with args=['echo 1'] and once with args=['echo 2']
189,190c184
<   def __init__(self,  loop_args: Union[_for_loop.ItemList, _pipeline_param.PipelineParam],
<                parallelism: int=None):
---

---

``` 

### What did you expect to happen:
The package content on Pypi should be the same published on Github

Thank you all.

items.title: Create componnet with metadata and metrics
items.body:
Hi team, 

I am trying to create reusable components with UI metadata and metrics persisted. It seems that I need to explicit about outputting metadata and metrics in the `component.yaml` file. For example, [confusion_metric](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/components/local/confusion_matrix/component.yaml)

```yaml
name: Confusion matrix
description: Calculates confusion matrix
inputs:
  - {name: Predictions,     type: GCSPath,        description: 'GCS path of prediction file pattern.'} # type: {GCSPath: {data_type: CSV}}
  - {name: Target lambda,   type: String, default: '', description: 'Text of Python lambda function which computes target value. For example, "lambda x: x[''a''] + x[''b'']". If not set, the input must include a "target" column.'}
  - {name: Output dir,      type: GCSPath,  description: 'GCS path of the output directory.'} # type: {GCSPath: {path_type: Directory}}
outputs:
  - {name: MLPipeline UI metadata, type: UI metadata}
  - {name: MLPipeline Metrics,     type: Metrics}
implementation:
  container:
    image: gcr.io/ml-pipeline/ml-pipeline-local-confusion-matrix:1.0.0
    command: [python2, /ml/confusion_matrix.py]
    args: [
      --predictions, {inputValue: Predictions},
      --target_lambda, {inputValue: Target lambda},
      --output,      {inputValue: Output dir},
    ]
    fileOutputs:
      MLPipeline UI metadata: /mlpipeline-ui-metadata.json
      MLPipeline Metrics:     /mlpipeline-metrics.json
```

However, in the [component specification](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/components/local/confusion_matrix/component.yaml). It mentions that `fileOutputs` is a `Legacy property` and should not be used. 

They are contradicting each other. Also, I could not find any documentation saying we need to use `fileOutputs` in the `component.yaml` file to persist UI metadata and metrics.

So I wonder what is the correct way to output UI metadata and metrics?

Thanks
Bin

items.title: KFP_VERSION in sync.py needs to be updated
items.body:
Right now, KFP profile controller deploys visualization server and artifact fetcher servers of 1.0.0-rc.3 version, but they should be deploying 1.0.0 now.

outdated config: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/blob/316c3f16698fce5de8349daf1a59756aeaeec18a/pipeline/installs/multi-user/pipelines-profile-controller/params.env#L1

items.title: Add AWS overlay for production users
items.body:
Currently, [platform-agnostic](https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/tree/master/manifests/kustomize/env/platform-agnostic) works well on AWS for user who like to experience KFP features. We(AWS) get some feedbacks users want to use more stable AWS services to replace some of the components in KFP. S3 and RDS start to be widely voiced. 

I think pipeline team build good abstraction here, for example, GCP users can easily build minio-gcs-gateway and cloudsql proxy to override base manifest.

In AWS, we'd like to adopt similar solution, minio-s3-gateway is straighforward, however, [RDS-proxy](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/proxy/) recently released is kind of complex to setup and it raise bar to setup KFP in production environment. 

We probably like to plug RDS to KFP components directly if sql proxy is not that straightforward on AWS. There're some work already one in Kubeflow v1.0.x. Just create this issue to track our work on standalone manifest. 

- https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/pipeline/
- https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/rds/


Please leave comments or suggestions and we can have more discussion. 


/cc @PatrickXYS

items.title: Document how to configure GCP permissions for a user namespace.
items.body:
Current draft
```
#### Configuring Google Cloud permissions for namespace
#### Granting Google Cloud permissions to UI Artifact Preview and Visualization

For artifacts stored on Google Cloud Storage (GCS), Kubeflow Pipelines deploys
artifact fetcher servers on user namespaces. The servers use `default-editor`
Kubernetes service account, so that they are using the same Google service
account as pipeline runs.
```

items.title: kfp component ml_engine deploy version param is incorrectly typed
items.body:
### What steps did you take:

I tried to specify the `version` param to the gcp ml_engine deploy component via:

```
 mlengine_deploy_op = comp.load_component_from_url('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/pipelines/1.0.0/components/gcp/ml_engine/deploy/component.yaml')

. . .

 upload_task = mlengine_deploy_op(
    model_id=model_id,
    project_id=project_id,
    python_version=python_version,
    runtime_version=runtime_version,
    version_id=version_id,
    model_uri=model_uri,
    model={
        'onlinePredictionLogging': True,
        'onlinePredictionConsoleLogging': True,
    },
    version={
        'packageUris': package_uris,
        'predictionClass': prediction_class,
    },
)
```

### What happened:

Received a type error that str object (version) does not support assignment
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 174, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
    exec code in run_globals

    main()
  File "/ml/kfp_component/launcher/__main__.py", line 31, in main
    launch(args.file_or_module, args.args)
  File "kfp_component/launcher/launcher.py", line 45, in launch
    return fire.Fire(module, command=args, name=module.__name__)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/fire/core.py", line 127, in Fire

    result = fn(*varargs, **kwargs)
  File "kfp_component/google/ml_engine/_deploy.py", line 68, in deploy
    wait_interval)
  File "kfp_component/google/ml_engine/_create_version.py", line 55, in create_version
    version['deploymentUri'] = deployemnt_uri
TypeError: 'str' object does not support item assignment
```

### What did you expect to happen:

I expected to be able to pass additional version parameters as a dictionary as described in https://cloud.google.com/ml-engine/reference/rest/v1/projects.models.versions and https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/components/gcp/ml_engine/deploy/component.yaml#L64:L69

However, this type is being declared as a str when it should be a dict: https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/components/gcp/container/component_sdk/python/kfp_component/google/ml_engine/_create_version.py#L47

This is ultimately based on the assumption that fire is using the docstring to do type hinting.

items.title: How to pass mlpipeline-metrics saved in one component to another component
[Question] ComponentSpec that can specify Kubernetes resources

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
I understand from a few KFP issues that component specs (in yaml) are the most portable way to specify our tasks, but I have not found a way to do the following:

I want to convert a component I had a while back where I explicitly created a `ContainerOp` to a component yaml spec.

The example I have is
```
@kfp.dsl.component
def export_to_nfs(save_path):
    export_op = kfp.dsl.ContainerOp(name='export',
                                    image='alpine',
                                    command=['sh', '-c'],
                                    arguments=['echo hi > /mnt/foobar.txt'],
                                    )
    export_op.container.add_env_from(V1EnvFromSource(secret_ref=V1SecretEnvSource(name='my-secret', optional=False)))
    nfs_volume = V1Volume(name='nfs-volume', nfs=V1NFSVolumeSource(server='a-nfs-server.com',
                                                                   path='/path/to/save/stuff',
                                                                   read_only=False))

    export_op.add_pvolumes(pvolumes={'/mnt': nfs_volume})
    return export_op
```

But looking at https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/sdk/python/kfp/components/_structures.py#L235, there doesn't seem to be a way to specify any of those kubernetes resources in the yaml spec.

Is what I'm trying to achieve possible in KFP currently?

items.body:
### What steps did you take:
While deploying Kubeflow Pipelines Standalone (v 1.0.0-rc.4), minio deployment does not fail, but however logs 401 error message. The reason is that in the deploymnet `manifests/kustomize/env/gcp/minio-gcs-gateway/minio-gcs-gateway-deployment.yaml` there is no `GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS` envrionement variable or no `serviceAccountName` spec defined.

### What did you expect to happen:

items.title: [Regression] SDK Compiler fails to compile a pipeline containing a container_op with PipelineParam in base_image

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
### What steps did you take:
The bug appear only in `1.0.0-rc.3`, it does not exist in `0.5.1`.
Given a container_op whose **base_image** contains a **PipelineParam** (pipeline argument for instance), the compiler cannot compile a pipeline containing such container_op.

### What happened:
The compile fails with this error message:
```
RuntimeError: Internal compiler error: Found unresolved PipelineParam.
Please create a new issue at https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/issues attaching the pipeline code and the pipeline package.
```

### What did you expect to happen:
The pipeline must compile successfuly

### Environment:
python `3.7` + kfp `1.0.0-rc.3`
`Pipfile.lock` is attached.


How did you deploy Kubeflow Pipelines (KFP)?
No installation is used, this happen in python sdk.

KFP SDK version: `1.0.0-rc.3`


### Anything else you would like to add: Reproducing bug
#### Python code
```python
from kfp.compiler import Compiler
from kfp.components import func_to_container_op
from kfp.dsl import pipeline

def print_version():
    import sys
    print(sys.version)

@pipeline(name="reproduce image bug")
def test_pipeline(python_version: str):
    func_to_container_op(func=print_version, base_image=f"library/python:{python_version}")()

Compiler().compile(test_pipeline, package_path="toto.yaml")
```

#### The bug does not exist in kfp `0.5.1`
```bash
!pip install kfp==0.5.1
```
Code runs **successfully**.

#### The bug appears with kfp `1.0.0-rc.3`
```bash
!pip install kfp==1.0.0-rc.3 --pre
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5963615/86464802-95f28400-bd30-11ea-9a6a-d6161d1192ff.png)

```

### What happened:
The module cache-deployer-deployment can't start because of:
```
+ kubectl certificate approve cache-server.kubeflow
No resources found
Error from server (Forbidden): certificatesigningrequests.certificates.k8s.io "cache-server.kubeflow" is forbidden: user not permitted to approve requests with signerName "kubernetes.io/legacy-unknown"
```

### What did you expect to happen:

### Environment:
Localhost environment on [K3D](https://k3d.io/):
```
k3d create kubeflow -w 3
k3d get kubeconfig kubeflow --switch
```

```

Related to this recent change in Kube: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/86933/files
I think the cache-deployer clusterrole needs to be tweaked（manifests/kustomize/base/cache-deployer/cluster-scoped/cache-deployer-clusterrole.yaml）:
```
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  labels:
    app: kubeflow-pipelines-cache-deployer-clusterrole
  name: kubeflow-pipelines-cache-deployer-clusterrole
rules:
- apiGroups:
  - certificates.k8s.io
  resources:
  - certificatesigningrequests
  - certificatesigningrequests/approval
  verbs:
  - create
  - delete
  - get
  - update
- apiGroups:
  - admissionregistration.k8s.io
  resources:
  - mutatingwebhookconfigurations
  verbs:
  - create
  - get
- apiGroups:
  - certificates.k8s.io
  resources:
  - signers
  resourceNames:
  - kubernetes.io/legacy-unknown
  verbs:
  - approve
```
add 'approve' (verb) 'signers' (resource) for 'certificates.k8s.io' (apiGroup), it works now. report this bug.

When passing output references to inputs consumed as files, everything works fine.
When passing constant strings to inputs consumed as files, the artifact names are not sanitized leading to invalid workflows.

```yaml
templates:
    - inputs:
      parameters:
      - {name: model_dir_uri}
      artifacts:
      - raw: {data: ''}
        path: /tmp/inputs/Default_data/data
        name: Default data
```

```
invalid spec: templates.continuous-training-pipeline.tasks.download-from-gcs templates.download-from-gcs.inputs.artifacts[0].name: 'Default data' is invalid: Parameter/Artifact name must consist of alpha-numeric characters, '_' or '-' e.g. my_param_1, MY-PARAM-1
```

items.title: De-hardcode output paths in AWS components

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
See the parent issue: https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/issues/4100

Some components are using the deprecated `fileOutputs` attribute. See the [query](
https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/search?q=fileOutputs+filename%3Acomponent.yaml&unscoped_q=fileOutputs+filename%3Acomponent.yaml)

The `fileOutputs` was deprecated from the start and should not be used in any non-legacy components.

We need to migrate from the deprecated `fileOutputs` to use the correct `{outputPath: output_name}` command-line placeholders instead.

Example:

Before:
```yaml
implementation:
  container:
    command:
    - my_prog.py
    - --param1
    - value1
    fileOutputs:
      some_output: /some/hardcoded/path
```
After:
```yaml
implementation:
  container:
    command:
    - my_prog.py
    - --param1
    - value1
    - --some-output
    - {outputPath: some_output}
```

The component code should be modified to receive all output paths through command-line arguments instead of hard-codong any paths.

An example of the correction: https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/pull/580/files#diff-9c31c4b41f436d2bbdfc9c97d40b9fe1
https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/pull/580/files#diff-ec0c67e038e3087e2bb01d439771bddc

items.title: Allow specifying inputs to be excluded from cache validation process
items.body: My pipeline steps currently take `pod_name: str = '{{pod.name}}'` argument so that my component can be made aware of its own metadata environment. Obviously, the pod name changes every run, which means kubeflow's caching mechanism won't work, even if nothing about the component inputs, code or outputs actually changed. I think there should be a) a first-class way for components to get info about their runtime metadata and/or b) a way to at least exclude my `pod_name` param so that the caching mechanism will ignore it if its value changes run to run. Perhaps we can expose `pod_name` as an environment variable inside each container?

items.title: [Feature Request] Add parallelism for dsl.ParallelFor

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
**Use Case**

Large data mining job is often split into many small jobs. Given the limit shared resource of external services (e.g., DataFlow), we can only run a few small jobs simultaneously. 

Global parallelism works to some degree but lack flexibility, e.g., with global parallelism at 1, any in-cluster task can block launching jobs to external services.

Argo supports template-level parallelism
https://github.com/argoproj/argo/blob/master/examples/parallelism-nested-workflow.yaml#L19
https://github.com/argoproj/argo/blob/master/examples/parallelism-nested-dag.yaml#L15

**Feature request**

```python
with dsl.ParallelFor(loopidy_doop, parallelism=2) as item:
    // DAG in loop here
```
There will be at most 2 loop-DAG running in parallel.

items.title: Storing and Accessing a Private Dataset for a Pipeline

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
/kind question

**Question**
What is the recommended way to store and access a private dataset (~200GB extracted) for use in a component in a Kubeflow pipeline run on GCP?

**Context/Environment**
For context, (not sure if relevant) my data is currently on a GCP VM instance, I’m using PyTorch, and I’ll be using preemtible VMs for my GPU nodes. And I’m using Kubeflow v1.0.2 and have already followed the guides for deploying it (w/ KF pipelines) on GCP.

**More Granularly**
1. How should I store a private dataset on GCP?
2. How should I transfer this data to the GCP storage mechanism?
3. How should I access this data from a Kubeflow pipeline component using PyTorch?
4. How does this method ensure low-latency for fetching training batches, close enough to that of a local filesystem?
5. How should I store and access transformations/preprocessing of this dataset that will be prone to change? (Whereas the dataset can be read-only)

items.title: Using Pipeline parameters in metadata
items.body:
### What steps did you take:
Create this component file `hello_component.yaml`
```
name: Hello component
description: Prints hello world
inputs:
- {name: input_1, type: String, description: 'Data for Input 1'}
metadata:
  annotations:
    my_annot: {inputValue: input_1}
implementation:
  container:
    image: image="library/bash:4.4.23",
    command: [sh, -c]
    args: ["echo", "hello, world!"]
```
and this pipeline file `hello_pipeline.py`
```
import kfp
from kfp import dsl

hello_op = kfp.components.load_component_from_file('hello_component.yaml')

@dsl.pipeline(
    name="Hello World Pipeline",
    description="This pipeline prints hello, world!")
def hello_pipeline():
    hello_op(input_1='my input') 
```

These information should be kept in the changelog:

* [x] PR title
* [x] PR number
  * PR number must be in the commit message like format `#4017`
* [x] issue(s) fixed

items.title: Mysql kustomize v3 manifest for both generic and gcp stack
Cache - Limit the attributes that affect the cache key

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
A customer has reported this issue. They're adding unique run_id labels to the tasks which effectively disables the cache. They want those labels to not prevent cache reuse.

Currently the cache key is based on the whole Argo template spec excluding the outputs.

We may switch to a limited subset:
```yaml
template:
  inputs: ...
  container:
    image: ....
    command: ...
    args: ...
    env: ...
    volumeMounts:
  volumes:
```

items.title: [Test infra] Sample/e2e tests are not testing against pending SDK changes.
items.body:
PR https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/pull/3934 is intended to fix a bug introduced by https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/pull/3861, which will cause pipelines that download prebuilt components to fail (e.g., XGBoost training sample).

IIUC, our presubmit e2e/sample test should have blocked https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/pull/3861 in that case, which did not happen.

items.title: [Backend] Some workflows leak from TTL auto cleanup

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
### What steps did you take:
1. Schedule a large number of workflows
2. Some workflows ended up with strange error state like `phase: Error` instead of `phase: Failed`
3. Wait for more than 7 days

### What happened:
The workflows in `phase: Error` are not GCed by https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/6189681436c09470f9a520ee4e0d94fa75d47f57/backend/Dockerfile.persistenceagent#L21

This causes too many workflows piling up and overloaded the kubernetes api server.

### What did you expect to happen:
Any workflow reaching a final status should be GCed after TTL (default 7 days).

items.title: [Release] Changelog Process after 1.0

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
## Background
The current changelog tool: https://github.com/github-changelog-generator/github-changelog-generator always queries all issues and PRs, it soon ran out of github quota even if a personal token is provided. Also it's no longer actively maintained. We need to investigate a new tool that suits our need.

## Requirements
Ideally, I think we have these requirements:
* works stably
* PR authors/maintainers can edit some metadata in PR to categorize PRs in changelog, e.g. we'd want different areas, and different types (bug, feature, misc).
* it can handle cherry picks

items.title: [Release] Version format conflict between semver and pypi

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
[Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/) is not compatible with [PEP 440](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/).

They are compatible with normal versions like 1.0.1, 1.2.0...
but they are incompatible with rc versions:
* semver like 1.0.0-rc.2
* pypi uses PEP 440, like 1.0.0rc2

When running `python setup.py --quiet sdist`, 1.0.0-rc.2 format is also recognized, and will be converted to 1.0.0rc2.

I'm creating this issue to track further discovery if this can become an issue.

/cc @Ark-kun @numerology 

If this is a real problem, we may choose to:
* follow PEP 440 standard instead and get rid of semver format

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: The community is welcome to contribute.

labels.name: status/triaged
labels.description: Whether the issue has been explicitly triaged

items.body:
### What steps did you take:

Created a persistent volume claim using a `VolumeOp`:

```python
    vop = dsl.VolumeOp(
        name="shared-data",
        resource_name="shared-data",
        size="100G",
        storage_class="nfs",
    ).set_display_name("Prepare volume")
```

Attempted to mount the PVC to every operation in a pipeline using:

```python
    dsl.get_pipeline_conf().add_op_transformer(
        mount_pvc(pvc_name=vop.volume.persistent_volume_claim.claim_name, volume_mount_path=MOUNT_PATH)
    )
```

### What happened:
During compilation, the `add_op_transformer` attempts to invoke the `add_volume_mount` method on the `VolumeOp`, producing an error:

```
AttributeError: 'VolumeOp' object has no attribute 'add_volume_mount'
```

### What did you expect to happen:

The documentation states that transfomers take and return a `ContainerOp`:

https://kubeflow-pipelines.readthedocs.io/en/latest/source/kfp.dsl.html#kfp.dsl.PipelineConf.add_op_transformer

Given that, I would expect them to be bypassed for `VolumeOp` (or other `ResourceOp` operations), and hence this compilation should succeed.

KFP SDK version: <!-- Please attach the output of this shell command: $pip list | grep kfp -->

I'm filing this issue due to this discussion: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/1154#discussion_r430105919

### What steps did you take:
Deploy Multi-User KFP based on https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/1154

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: ml-pipeline-config
data:
  config.json: |
    {
      "DBConfig": {
        "DriverName": "mysql",
        "DataSourceName": "",
        "DBName": "mlpipeline"
      },
      "ObjectStoreConfig":{
        "AccessKey": "minio",
        "SecretAccessKey": "minio123",
        "BucketName": "mlpipeline",
        "PipelinePath": "pipelines",
        "Secure": false
      },
      "InitConnectionTimeout": "6m",
      "DefaultPipelineRunnerServiceAccount": "pipeline-runner",
      "VisualizationService":{
        "Name": "ml-pipeline-visualizationserver",
        "Port": 8888
      },
      "MULTIUSER": true
    }
```

### What happened:
`apiserver` is in a `CrashLoopBackOff` requiring `ML_PIPELINE_VISUALIZATIONSERVER_SERVICE_HOST`

```
$ kubectl -n kubeflow logs ml-pipeline-565dc6f88b-b89rx
I0526 12:50:31.498547       1 client_manager.go:134] Initializing client manager
I0526 12:50:31.498826       1 config.go:50] Config DBConfig.ExtraParams not specified, skipping
I0526 12:50:31.670237       1 client_manager.go:356] We already own mlpipeline
I0526 12:50:31.672566       1 client_manager.go:164] Client manager initialized successfully
I0526 12:50:31.676288       1 main.go:168] Samples already loaded in the past. Skip loading.
I0526 12:50:31.676759       1 resource_manager.go:869] Default experiment already exists! ID: ef20ce9c-6c50-4812-b132-7f6319268d61
I0526 12:50:31.676781       1 main.go:113] Starting Http Proxy
I0526 12:50:31.677265       1 main.go:84] Starting RPC server

```

When MultiUser is enabled, it should be that the changes of this PR take over: kubeflow/pipelines#3495
However, it must be that these lines run independently to whether the feature is enabled or not:
https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/508f31aa0feea5f00d4960207dbe14b535513f99/backend/src/apiserver/main.go#L95-L101
